questions.text: What is blockchain in the context of IIoT?
options: A type of physical chain used in factories
A centralized database managed by a single authority
A distributed, immutable ledger for recording transactions
A new internet protocol
questions.correctAnswer: A distributed, immutable ledger for recording transactions

questions.text: What is a key security benefit of using blockchain in an IIoT supply chain?
options: It makes data transfer faster
It provides a tamper-resistant record of transactions and asset provenance
It encrypts all internet traffic
It eliminates the need for sensors
questions.correctAnswer: It provides a tamper-resistant record of transactions and asset provenance

questions.text: A 'smart contract' on a blockchain is:
options: A legal document written by a lawyer
A self-executing contract with the terms of the agreement directly written into code
A contract that is stored in the cloud
A verbal agreement between two parties
questions.correctAnswer: A self-executing contract with the terms of the agreement directly written into code

questions.text: How can smart contracts be used in an IIoT context?
options: To automatically trigger a payment when a shipment of goods arrives and its condition is verified by sensors
To write emails
To control the temperature of a smart thermostat
To design 3D models
questions.correctAnswer: To automatically trigger a payment when a shipment of goods arrives and its condition is verified by sensors

questions.text: What is a major challenge for integrating blockchain with IIoT?
options: Blockchain is too transparent
The scalability and transaction speed of many blockchain networks
There are no challenges
Blockchain is not secure enough
questions.correctAnswer: The scalability and transaction speed of many blockchain networks

questions.text: What is the difference between a public blockchain and a private (permissioned) blockchain?
options: Public blockchains are free, private blockchains are not
Anyone can join a public blockchain, while a private blockchain restricts participation
Public blockchains are less secure than private blockchains
Private blockchains are only for personal use
questions.correctAnswer: Anyone can join a public blockchain, while a private blockchain restricts participation

questions.text: Which type of blockchain is generally more suitable for enterprise and IIoT use cases?
options: Public blockchain
Private/Permissioned blockchain
Neither is suitable
Both are equally suitable

questions.text: The 'immutability' of a blockchain means that:
options: It is silent and does not speak
Data recorded on it can be easily changed
Once data is recorded, it is extremely difficult to alter or delete
It is immune to all cyber attacks
questions.correctAnswer: Once data is recorded, it is extremely difficult to alter or delete

questions.text: What role does 'consensus mechanism' play in a blockchain?
options: It helps participants reach an agreement on the state of the ledger
It is a type of sensor
It is a marketing strategy
It determines the physical location of the blockchain
questions.correctAnswer: It helps participants reach an agreement on the state of the ledger

questions.text: Which of the following is NOT a good use case for blockchain in IIoT?
options: Tracking pharmaceuticals through the supply chain
Real-time control of a high-speed robotic arm
Creating a trusted record of maintenance for an aircraft engine
Managing energy trading in a smart grid
questions.correctAnswer: Real-time control of a high-speed robotic arm
